name: Indian Gaur
description: The Indian Gaur is a massive bovine, known as the largest wild cattle species, with a muscular build.
spread_note: Found in India, Southeast Asia, and parts of China.
food_note: Grazes in forests and open areas, often near water.
proportions: Height: 1.7-2.2 m, length: 2.5-3.3 m, weight: 700-1,500 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 9 months, one calf born per female.
attractions: Impressive in zoos due to their size and strength.
projects_note: Vulnerable due to habitat loss; conservation focuses on protected areas.
breeding: Bred in some reserves to maintain genetic diversity.
